conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph of two objects, labeled A and B, moving from the same starting point in the same direction.
Identify the points on the graph where objects A and B start moving. These are marked as t_1 and t_2.
Examine the velocity-time graph to determine the acceleration of each object at these points.
At t_1, object A is moving upwards from t_1 to t_2, and object B is moving downwards from t_1 to t_2.
Since both objects start from the same velocity v_0, the acceleration at t_1 for both objects will be the same because acceleration is constant in this region.
Since the acceleration is the same for both objects at t_1, the velocity-time graph will show that the velocity of both objects is increasing at the same rate.
Conclude that the two objects have the same acceleration at t_1.
Yes, the two objects have the same acceleration at time t_1.
